fields.name: acne
fields.description: Acne is a common skin condition that occurs when hair follicles become clogged with oil and dead skin cells. It is characterized by blackheads, whiteheads, pimples, and cysts.

fields.name: eczema
fields.description: Eczema is a skin condition that causes red, itchy, and inflamed patches of skin. It can be triggered by a variety of factors, including allergies, irritants, and stress.

fields.name: rosacea
fields.description: Rosacea is a chronic skin condition that causes redness, swelling, and bumps on the face. It can also cause burning and stinging sensations, and in severe cases, thickened skin.

fields.name: seborrheic dermatitis
fields.description: Seborrheic dermatitis is a common skin condition that causes flaky, itchy, and red skin. It typically affects the scalp, face, and other oily areas of the body.

fields.name: urticaria
fields.description: Urticaria, also known as hives, is a skin condition that causes raised, itchy, and red welts on the skin. It can be triggered by a variety of factors, including allergies, medications, and infections.

fields.name: acne vulgaris
fields.description: Acne vulgaris is a common skin condition that occurs when hair follicles become clogged with oil and dead skin cells. It is characterized by blackheads, whiteheads, pimples, and cysts.

fields.name: basal cell carcinoma
fields.description: Basal cell carcinoma is a type of skin cancer that usually develops on areas of skin that have been exposed to the sun. It typically appears as a waxy bump or a flat, scaly patch.

fields.name: squamous cell carcinoma
fields.description: Squamous cell carcinoma is a type of skin cancer that usually develops on areas of skin that have been exposed to the sun. It typically appears as a firm, red nodule or a flat, scaly lesion.
